qas.question: Who did England propose to affiliate with Wales to quell Welsh nationalism?
Why did Britain not want Elizabeth to associate with conscientious objectors?
Who was the always the Prince of Wales?
Who wanted to name Elizabeth Princess of Wales?
In what year was the Welsh League of Youth established?
In what year did Herbert Morrison become Home Secretary?
In what year was the Welsh Gorsedd of Bards established?
Who rejected the idea of Elizabeth being appointed as the Constable of Caernarfon Castle?
Who rejected the idea of Elizabeth being appointed as patron of Urdd Gobaith Cymru?

context: During the war, plans were drawn up to quell Welsh nationalism by affiliating <a0_0>Elizabeth<a0_0/> more closely with Wales. Proposals, such as appointing her Constable of Caernarfon Castle or a patron of Urdd Gobaith Cymru (the Welsh League of Youth), were abandoned for various reasons, which included a fear of associating Elizabeth with conscientious objectors in the Urdd, at a time when <a1_0>Britain was at war<a1_0/>. Welsh politicians suggested that she be made Princess of Wales on her 18th birthday. <b8_0>Home Secretary, <a4_0>Herbert Morrison<b8_0/><a4_0/> supported the idea, but <b9_0>the King<b9_0/> rejected it because he felt such a title belonged solely to the wife of a Prince of Wales and the Prince of Wales had always been the <a3_0>heir apparent<a3_0/>. In <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>1946<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/>, she was inducted into the <a2_0>Welsh Gorsedd of Bards<a2_0/> at the National Eisteddfod of Wales.
